summary: REQ-3 appears implemented via global CSS changes to make Radix Select dropdowns scrollable with a fixed max-height and touch scrolling. REQ-1 is partially evidenced by new admin-mode state/validation and a separate mutation call that submits explicit player1/player2 principals, but the truncated diff does not show the actual UI rendering (labels/selectors) to confirm the full acceptance criteria. REQ-2 cannot be verified from the truncated backend diff; frontend hooks reference a new admin submission flow, but the corresponding backend entrypoint is not evidenced.

missing_requirements.requirement: Admins/score-auth-admins must see two separate member selectors labeled "Player 1" and "Player 2" in the Tournament -> Enter Scores tab, while non-admin users retain the existing opponent-only UX.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows admin-mode state (player1/player2) and branching submission logic, but the file is truncated before the JSX that would prove the presence of two labeled selectors and the preserved non-admin UI.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add a backend shared method for admin/score-auth-admin tournament score entry that accepts both Player 1 and Player 2 principals, enforces best-of-three validation, and applies the same tournament state checks as the existing flow.
missing_requirements.reason: backend/main.mo is truncated and does not show any new tournament admin score-submission entrypoint or its validation/state-check logic. Frontend references a new mutation hook, but the backend implementation is not evidenced in the provided diff excerpt.
